intro: Achoriphragma pavlovii, commonly known as the Pavlov's sandmat, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments. It has a limited distribution and is often found in sandy or rocky soils, where it survives with minimal water. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
